verses.plain: Woe to her that is filthy and polluted, to the oppressing city!

tokens.t: Woe to her that is filthy and polluted, to the oppressing city!

verses.plain: She obeyed not the voice; she received not correction; she trusted not in the LORD; she drew not near to her God.

tokens.t: She obeyed not the voice; she received not correction; she trusted not in the
; she drew not near to her God.

verses.plain: Her princes within her are roaring lions; her judges are evening wolves; they gnaw not the bones till the morrow.

tokens.t: Her princes within her
roaring lions; her judges
evening wolves; they gnaw not the bones till the morrow.

verses.plain: Her prophets are light and treacherous persons: her priests have polluted the sanctuary, they have done violence to the law.

tokens.t: Her prophets
light
treacherous persons: her priests have polluted the sanctuary, they have done violence to the law.

verses.plain: The just LORD is in the midst thereof; he will not do iniquity: every morning doth he bring his judgment to light, he faileth not; but the unjust knoweth no shame.

tokens.t: The just
in the midst thereof; he will not do iniquity: every morning doth he bring his judgment to light, he faileth not; but the unjust knoweth no shame.

verses.plain: I have cut off the nations: their towers are desolate; I made their streets waste, that none passeth by: their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, that there is none inhabitant.

tokens.t: I have cut off the nations: their towers are desolate; I made their streets waste, that none passeth by: their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, that there is none inhabitant.

verses.plain: I said, Surely thou wilt fear me, thou wilt receive instruction; so their dwelling should not be cut off, howsoever I punished them: but they rose early, and corrupted all their doings.

tokens.t: I said, Surely thou wilt fear me, thou wilt receive instruction; so their dwelling should not be cut off, howsoever I punished them: but they rose early,
corrupted all their doings.

verses.plain: ¶ Therefore wait ye upon me, saith the LORD, until the day that I rise up to the prey: for my determination is to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour upon them mine indignation, even all my fierce anger: for all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.

tokens.t: ¶ Therefore wait ye upon me, saith the
, until the day that I rise up to the prey: for my determination
to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour upon them mine indignation,
all my fierce anger: for all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.

verses.plain: For then will I turn to the people a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the LORD, to serve him with one consent.

tokens.t: For then will I turn to the people a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the
, to serve him with one consent.

verses.plain: From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia my suppliants, even the daughter of my dispersed, shall bring mine offering.

tokens.t: From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia my suppliants,
the daughter of my dispersed, shall bring mine offering.

verses.plain: In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for all thy doings, wherein thou hast transgressed against me: for then I will take away out of the midst of thee them that rejoice in thy pride, and thou shalt no more be haughty because of my holy mountain.

tokens.t: In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for all thy doings, wherein thou hast transgressed against me: for then I will take away out of the midst of thee them that rejoice in thy pride, and thou shalt no more be haughty because of my holy mountain.

verses.plain: I will also leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people, and they shall trust in the name of the LORD.

tokens.t: I will also leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people, and they shall trust in the name of the

verses.plain: The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies; neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth: for they shall feed and lie down, and none shall make them afraid.

tokens.t: The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies; neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth: for they shall feed and lie down, and none shall make
afraid.

verses.plain: ¶ Sing, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; be glad and rejoice with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.

tokens.t: ¶ Sing, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; be glad and rejoice with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.

verses.plain: The LORD hath taken away thy judgments, he hath cast out thine enemy: the king of Israel, even the LORD, is in the midst of thee: thou shalt not see evil any more.

tokens.t: The
hath taken away thy judgments, he hath cast out thine enemy: the king of Israel,
the
in the midst of thee: thou shalt not see evil any more.

verses.plain: In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not: and to Zion, Let not thine hands be slack.

tokens.t: In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not:
Zion, Let not thine hands be slack.

verses.plain: The LORD thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.

tokens.t: The
thy God in the midst of thee
mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.

verses.plain: I will gather them that are sorrowful for the solemn assembly, who are of thee, to whom the reproach of it was a burden.

tokens.t: I will gather
sorrowful for the solemn assembly,
are of thee,
the reproach of it
a burden.

verses.plain: Behold, at that time I will undo all that afflict thee: and I will save her that halteth, and gather her that was driven out; and I will get them praise and fame in every land where they have been put to shame.

tokens.t: Behold, at that time I will undo all that afflict thee: and I will save her that halteth, and gather her that was driven out; and I will get them praise and fame in every land where they have been put to shame.

verses.plain: At that time will I bring you again, even in the time that I gather you: for I will make you a name and a praise among all people of the earth, when I turn back your captivity before your eyes, saith the LORD.

tokens.t: At that time will I bring you
, even in the time that I gather you: for I will make you a name and a praise among all people of the earth, when I turn back your captivity before your eyes, saith the

footnotes.text: reproach…: Heb. the burden upon it was reproach
get…: Heb. set them for a praise
